text: testified as follows ....
- - - EXAMINATION
Good afternoon.  My name is Joe Lavin.  I'm here on behalf of the Defendant in this matter, David Spohn.  I'm here today to take your deposition. Prior to today, have you ever been deposed before?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just so you know, to my left and your right is the court reporter.  She's writing down everything that we say, so at the end of the day, there will be a written transcript with the questions that I ask you and the answers that you provide to those questions. It's important, because the court reporter is here, that all of your responses to my questions have to be verbal responses.  The court reporter can't take things down such as head nods yes or no, or indications with your hands to the left or the right, so you need to verbalize everything.  Okay?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm going to be asking you a series of questions.  If at any point you don't understand my question, let me know, and I'll do my best to rephrase it for you. All right?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you do answer a question, I'll assume you heard the question, you understood the question, and you're answering it truthfully and honestly to the best of your ability.  All right?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you understand that you are sworn in and under oath today?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the testimony you're about to give has the same force and effect as if we were testifying in court in front of a judge or a jury?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Yes.  I understand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  That being said, if you don't know or can't remember an answer to one of my questions, "I don't know" and "I can't remember" are perfectly acceptable responses.  All right?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't want you to guess at anything.  So if your answer is an estimation or an approximation, things like speed, distance, time of day, just let me know that your answer is an estimation or an approximation, and not an exact answer. All right?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Yes.

text: What happened in April of 2017 to lead to that?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: I had seen the orthopedic doctor that was treating me for my shoulder, and he had given me a second dose of Depo Medrol, I think it's called; it's a steroid.  And that was around 5:30 in the evening, and then by twelve o'clock midnight, I started experiencing rapid heartbeat and, you know, pretty bad AFib. So, it wouldn't correct itself, so after half-hour, I went to the emergency room, and they had to cardio- -- chemically cardiovert me.

text: Okay.

text: I think it's Grandview.  I don't know if it's called Quakertown Family Practice, but I know he's affiliated with Grandview Hospital.

text: Okay.  How many times did you go to see your primary care doctor related to this accident?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: I would say at least three times before I actually went to see the orthopedic doctor.

text: And what did your primary care doctor do for you, if anything?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: The primary care doctor, the first time on the 3rd, examined me, went through the whole thing just to see why I was in pain in the rib on the right side and to the chest.  They were afraid that there might have been some break or damage, so they sent me for an MRI -- not an MRI, a CAT scan that afternoon, so I had a CAT scan that same afternoon.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever follow-up with your primary to discuss the results of the CAT scan?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's your understanding of the results?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: They said that there was no internal damage that they saw or any internal injuries, and the ribs are just bruised.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then did you follow up again with your primary care doctor?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: Oh, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember why?
speaker: MR. LAVIN

text: 'Cause I was still experiencing pain.  And at that point, what they had done was they had prescribed some NSAIDs and Tylenol for the pain, but I really don't like taking the NSAIDs because of my, you know, heart and the reaction that it could have with the other medications. But I alternated that for a few weeks, and the pain was still there, so I went back at the end of the month, I believe, and told him that I was still having a lot of pain.  And at that point, it was really not only in the chest area, which was getting a little better, but mostly in the neck and shoulder area.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And the third time that you went to see your primary doctor, do you remember why that was?
speaker: MR. LAVIN
